alert.note: Alert for Carter; Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:02PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Love, southeastern Carter and western Marshall Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Overbrook to 6 miles northwest of Marietta to 3 miles east of Leon. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Marietta, Thackerville, Leon, Lebanon, Overbrook, Lake Murray, Burneyville, and western Lake Texoma. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 2 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
